name: df-ttg
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(cttg, cmpt(s0, universe, csb(s5, cmpo(s1, s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), crab(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wrex(s4, co(nat0, cicc, nat1), wceq(co(cv(s3), cfv(csg, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), co(cv(s4), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), co(cv(s2), cfv(csg, cv(s0)), cv(s1))))))), co(co(cv(s0), csts, cop(cfv(citv, cnx), cv(s5))), csts, cop(cfv(clng, cnx), cmpo(s1, s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), crab(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), w3o(wcel(cv(s3), co(cv(s1), cv(s5), cv(s2))), wcel(cv(s1), co(cv(s3), cv(s5), cv(s2))), wcel(cv(s2), co(cv(s1), cv(s5), cv(s3)))))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ toTG =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶[(s1 ‚àà(Base ` s0), s2 ‚àà(Base ` s0)‚Ü¶ { s3 ‚àà(Base ` s0)| ‚àÉ(s4 ‚àà(0[[,]]1),(s3[(-g ` s0)]s1)=(s4[(√ó ` s0)](s2[(-g ` s0)]s1)))})/ s5]((s0[sSet]<(Itv ` ndx), s5 >)[sSet]<(LineG ` ndx),(s1 ‚àà(Base ` s0), s2 ‚àà(Base ` s0)‚Ü¶ { s3 ‚àà(Base ` s0)|(s3 ‚àà(s1[s5]s2)‚à® s1 ‚àà(s3[s5]s2)‚à® s2 ‚àà(s1[s5]s3))})>))
comment: Define a function converting a subcomplex Hilbert space to a Tarski Geometry. It does so by equipping the structure with a betweenness operation. Note that because the scalar product is applied over the interval ` ( 0 [,] 1 ) ` , only spaces whose scalar field is a superset of that interval can be considered. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 24-Mar-2019.)
